data.title: Events
data.meta_site_name: Hochschule für Musik und Theater Hamburg
data.text:
Viva Polonia

The content on this page was translated automatically.

When the pictures learned to walk...

A journey through the film music of Poland

"When the pictures learned to walk" is a musical narrative through the historical symbiosis of Polish music and cinema, which led to films that moved the world.

We experience the classics from the beginnings in the Golden 20s to the legendary arthouse cinema during the Cold War to the present day, from insider tips to OSCAR award winners.

The German-Polish "CuCo Salon Orchestra" with soloists from the young artists' collective Culture Connects will take you on an anecdote-filled adventure from Warsaw to Hollywood.

With music from films by Andrzej Wajda, Krzysztof Kieślowski, Roman Polański, Krzysztof Zanussi, Paweł Pawlikowski and others.

Works by Wojciech Kilar, Władysław Szpilman, Henryk Wars, Jerzy Petersburski, Bronisław Kaper, Krzysztof Komeda, Fryderyk Chopin

from the films: "Pan Tadeusz" (1999), "Three Colors White" (1994), "The Pianist" (2002), "Cold War - The Latitude of Love" (2018), "Schindler's List" (1993), "Rosemary's Baby" (1968), "Lili" (1953), "Królowa Przedmieścia"/The Suburban Queen (1938), "Szczęśliwa 13"/The Lucky 13 (1938), "Co mój mąż robi w nocy?"/What does my husband do at night? (1934), "Piętro wyżej"/Ene Etage höher(1937) and many more.

Artists:

Mira Graczyk - soprano

Marcel Durka - baritone

Elizaveta Don - piano

Alina Ohem - guitar

Eduard Don - clarinet

Dominik Löhrke - saxophone

Christian von Seebeck - bass

Roman Ohem - violin and moderation

Admission: 15,00 EUR

Reduced: 10,00 EUR

Ticket reservations and advance booking at karten@culture-connects.de and at the box office

Eine Produktion vom Förderverein Culture Connects e. V. nach einem Konzept von Roman Ohem.
